cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 560 miles (900 km) east of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting slowly west-northwest, then west to west-southwest this weekend toward the northern Leeward Islands and potentially near the Virgin Islands/Puerto Rico early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None specifically forecast – center expected to pass east or just northeast of the northern Leeward Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<=3% chance) but occasional gusty squalls are possible late weekend into early next week.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible this weekend into early next week with isolated higher totals causing urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip currents may affect harbor approaches and outer anchorages.
